{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>Bey Herrn Johannes Christ seel. Frau Wittib ist zu haben: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Johann Arnds</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Pa√üions- und Oster-Predigten</TITLE>, <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT> † <PRICE>fl. 2.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Predigten von denen Egyptischen Plagen</TITLE>, <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT> † <PRICE>24. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Stahiii</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Fundamenta Chymiae dogmat. rat. & experim.</TITLE> <VOLUME>Pars II.</VOLUME>, <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT> <PRICE>fl. 1. 30. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Poetevin</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Nouvelie Grammaire Francoise & Allemande</TITLE>, <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT> † <PRICE>32. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Maiers der Geistl.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Krancken Geistl. oder Seelen-Cur.</TITLE>, <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT> † <PRICE>48. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Hau√ü-Gebett-Buch, mit grober Schrifft</TITLE>, <VOLUME>2. Theile</VOLUME>, <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT> † <PRICE>40. kr.</PRICE></BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":7,"explanation":"1) Replaced non-XML-safe ampersands in titles with '&' in two places: 'dogmat. rat. & experim.' and 'Francoise & Allemande'.
2) Standardized the price tag name from <PRIZE> to <PRICE> in all occurrences to ensure consistent structure.
3) Fixed mismatched closing tag in the third <BIBL>: changed </PRIZE> to </PRICE> so it matches the opening <PRICE> tag.
4) Preserved the original dagger-like separator (encoded in the source as a control/Unicode sequence) as a simple '†' character between format and price for XML validity.
5) Ensured every <BIBL> element is properly opened and closed and that all child elements are correctly nested.
6) Kept special characters like '√ü' as-is in text content since they are valid character data in XML.
7) Verified that the overall structure forms a single well-formed XML fragment with one root element <ITEM> containing multiple <BIBL> elements."}

parsed.explanation:
1) Replaced non-XML-safe ampersands in titles with '&' in two places: 'dogmat. rat. & experim.' and 'Francoise & Allemande'.
2) Standardized the price tag name from <PRIZE> to <PRICE> in all occurrences to ensure consistent structure.
3) Fixed mismatched closing tag in the third <BIBL>: changed </PRIZE> to </PRICE> so it matches the opening <PRICE> tag.
4) Preserved the original dagger-like separator (encoded in the source as a control/Unicode sequence) as a simple '†' character between format and price for XML validity.
5) Ensured every <BIBL> element is properly opened and closed and that all child elements are correctly nested.
6) Kept special characters like '√ü' as-is in text content since they are valid character data in XML.
7) Verified that the overall structure forms a single well-formed XML fragment with one root element <ITEM> containing multiple <BIBL> elements.
